FuncDef:
The dcn ospf timer dead command sets the OSPF neighbor dead interval for DCN interfaces.
The undo dcn ospf timer dead command restores the default OSPF neighbor dead interval of DCN interfaces.
The default OSPF neighbor dead interval of P2P DCN interfaces is four times that of hello interval .
The default OSPF neighbor dead interval of P2P DCN serial interfaces is four times that of hello interval .

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an OSPF neighbor dead interval.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 235926000, in seconds.

Examples: Warning: This operation will enable DCN function. Continue? [Y/N]:y
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After DCN is enabled for an interface, the system automatically creates DCN serial interfaces. To set the OSPF neighbor dead interval for DCN serial interfaces, run the dcn ospf timer dead command.
If an interface does not receive hello packets from an OSPF neighbor within the specified interval, the interface considers the neighbor Down.
Prerequisites
DCN has been enabled using the dcn command in the interface view.
Precautions
The interval value specified in the dcn ospf timer dead command must be greater than the interval at which Hello packets are sent. In addition, routers on the same network segment must have the same OSPF neighbor dead interval.
If the dcn ospf timer dead command is run in the DCN view, the OSPF neighbor dead interval is set for all DCN interfacesIf the dcn ospf timer dead command is run in the interface view, the OSPF neighbor dead interval is set for DCN interface.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
